title: Camellia japonica
summary: Camellia japonica, known as common camellia,[2] or Japanese camellia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. There are thousands of cultivars of C. japonica in cultivation, with many colors and forms of flowers. In the U.S. it is sometimes called japonica, a name more often used in the UK for Chaenomeles (flowering quince).[3]
